info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pike and southwestern Montgomery Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Little Missouri Falls Recreation Area, or 13 miles northeast of Umpire, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Langley... Fancyhill... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
